page.title: 13EDUCATION CHANGE SINCE 1945
page.content: Since 1918 the school leaving age has risen to 16 from 14.One of the biggest changes is discipline and attitudes to work.The relationship between pupil and teacher is also more relaxed.The cane was readily given even by prefects. There was also a strong sense of patriotism. Lessons were similar although now there is a wider choice and pupils are encouraged to work for themselves rather than be dictated to.This change is due to greater facilities e.g.laborortories calculators computers t.v etc.Classes were larger, about forty pupils but schools were small- 300 was large: boys and girls were always separated.Only in grammar schools were uniforms worn.Grammar school was fee paying unless a exam similar too the 11+ was passed.(Based on interviews with OAPS')
